resources.string: The Show Must Go On
Gather Black Pigment from Black Fungus around Ebonscale Reach for Magistrate Redridge.
"Why is that?"

We were betrayed by the Dynasty Empress, but we've adapted - we've learned that the secret is not forgetting what makes us human.\n\nThat's why practicing the arts remains one of our highest priorities.
"Really? What type of arts?"

Theater! In fact, I've written a historical piece about the the Taiying Empress' journey to Aeternum.\n\nBut I have only one copy of the script - we need more for the actors, and well, we've run out of ink.
"Maybe I can help?"

You could. The black fungus that grows around Ebonscale Reach actually contains the perfect pigment.\n\nIf you could gather enough, we could mix up more ink. You would be honored for supporting the arts, dearie.
I do think the fungus will make for an excellent ink.\n\nThis is the only way we can pull off the production.

Ah, perfect! I'll start mixing the ink right away, and then I can recopy my script for 'The Empress's Journey'.\n\nI realize what a trifle this must seem in the face of the Corrupted, but we must follow through.
Collect {itemName} from Void Pitchers around Ebonscale Reach
Statuette Stash
Collect four Dragon Statuettes to deliver to Zeng Lingyun in Ebonscale so she can locate the dock leading to the Empress's fleet.
"Do you know why she fell?"

Yes. Her thirst for power overcame her sense of respect and decorum. It is a tragic tale.\n\nThe past is gone, however, and it is the present for which I am now concerned. The Empress is a threat to the entire world.
"A threat to the entire world?"

Taiying was once a beloved leader and a caring confidant. She dreamt of returning to our homeland and retaking her throne.\n\nThose aspirations twisted her mind, and she has now constructed an entire Corrupted fleet to sail abroad.
"Is there some way to stop her?"

Yes, we must defeat her and destroy her ships, but simply reaching her is the difficult part.\n\nThere are dragon statuettes at shrines around Ebonscale, in Aeternum's elements of Fire, Water, Earthâ€¦ And Air! You thought I was going to say Wood and Metal, didn't you? These are Aeternum-made statuettes and obey the island's elemental rules.
The dragon statuettes are the only way to gain access to the Empress's docks.
Ah, thank you. Empress Taiying fancies herself a dragon goddess, but she is only a human who has succumbed to Corruption.\n\nWith you as our champion, I believe we can bring her down for good.
Collect the {itemName} from the Metal Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Water Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Earth Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Fire Shrine
End of Her Reign (Expedition)

Enter the boat in the Dynasty Fortress, sail to the Dynasty Port, defeat Dynasty Captains and destroy her ships, and then defeat Empress Zhou Taiying herself. Then report back to Zeng Lingyun in the Ebonscale Settlement.
"Where is she?"

You will find her, and her entire fleet, within the Dynasty Shipyard. I do not know exactly where, so you will have to search inside. \n\nI hope you realize the importance of this - she cannot be permitted to launch that fleet.
"Could she get past the Stormwall?"

At first, we all hoped the Empress would come to realize the futility of her plan.\n\nNow, we have learned her plan includes some way of pushing through. I know not how - only that she must be stopped. Good luck, Champion.
Whatever it takes, you must destroy Empress Taiying and her foul fleet.\n\nNot just for Aeternum, but for all the world.
Ah, I have heard the news - at last her dark reign has ended.\n\nThank you, Champion. You have put a deeply troubled soul to rest, and in doing so, you may have very well saved the world.
Venture into the {POITags}
Defeat Empress Zhou
Captain's Orders
Defeat Undead Pirates and obtain the Captain's Puzzlebox for Elder Danya in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"I came from the southern territories."

Perfect, perfect. Then you are familiar with these Lost Pirates - they are plague down there, and here as well.\n\nThey also present us with an opportunity to acquire supplies we cannot get elsewhere.
"What kind of supplies?"

Ah! One of the pirates' wrecks contains some cargo that is even more precious than azoth. \n\nIt is something so scarce on Aeternum that I hesitate to speak its name aloud lest we be overheard by covetous interlopers.
"You want me to retrieve this cargo?"

For now, I only need the manifest, to verify the contents of what is stored on the ship.\n\nRumors say it is locked inside a puzzlebox - find this puzzlebox, and get me the manifest within, and I will see you rewarded.
Find the Puzzlebox and recover the manifest within, and then you know what I value most in this world.
You have the manifest? Then you have found me out. \n\nThere is one thing I value in this world more than anything, and that is... Fine literature. Mmm.
Retrieve cargo from {POITags}
Kill {targetName}
Kill {targetName} for the {itemName}
Flower for the Departed
Place a Blossoming Flower on the Altar of the Departed in the Haunted Crypt for Elder Danya in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"That's not surprising."
You must understand - the people here - many have actually been given the comfort of eternal rest. \n\nIt's a blessing after they've endured so much at the hands of the Empress.
"How does that happen?"
A sacred ceremony brought from their homeland, but forgotten in the disaster.\n\nIf you can take this Blossoming Flower to the Shrine of the Departed, it will bring them peace... or so I hope.
The Blossoming Flower, for how full of life it is, should help the spirits rest.
Oh, I was just reading a book of Bhakti kaal. Not enough to share I'm afraid.\n\nBut you placed the Blossoming Flower? Did it help the drowned Dynasty citizens find rest?
"Not that I could tell."

Hmm. Perhaps it will work in time. At the very least, you've brought peace for some surviving citizens here.\n\nIt should feel good to do good - not as good as the satisfaction of completing an epic poem, but still good, I hope.
Honor the flood victims at {POITags}
Place the Blossoming Flower on the Altar of the Departed
Hidden
Defeat The Cursed One
Ebonscale Alligators
Collect Ebony Scales from Ebonscale Alligators for Survivalist Hopkins in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"I'm always up for a challenge."

Excellent! Let's make it a competition, then! Who can skin the most Ebonscale Alligators?\n\nThere's a hollow in Moss Mire that teems with them. Gather their scales, and I'll make you a fine new gatorskin satchel.
"Gatorksin bag?"
You can always use more bags lugging your loot around Aeternum, no? \n\nAre you up for the challenge?

I have to admit that this challenge is not only for the bag and the bragging rights. \n\nThese alligators are a threat - have you ever been drowned and eaten by a gator? It's an experience that haunts you forever.
Impressive! As much as it pains me to say it, you are a better Insti-gator than I am! Heh? You like it? My pun game is as sharp as their teeth.\n\nAs promised, here is your new bag.
Invade the {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName} from Ebonscale Alligators
What Makes the Shallows Crimson
Collect samples of life in the Crimson Shallows for Barkeep Bao in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"What makes it unique?"

That's the question you can help answer! There are so many unanswered questions on Aeternum - it keeps me awake at night!\n\n If we could just answer this one, I would be happy. What makes the Crimson Shallows crimson?
"Why is this question so important?"

Because it has perplexed me since I arrived as a stowaway on the Empress's ship.\n\nThis island's deep mysteries are best left to adventurers and scholars. Gather me samples from the Shallows, and this one, I might solve!
I'll need plants from the area as well as samples from the fauna that eat them. \n\nThank you for assisting me in this endeavor.
Wow, that is a lot of samples! I can certainly find the common element.\n\nI suspect it is an algae-like substance that, when exposed to heat, makes the Shallows red. We will soon find out!
Gather {itemName} from Boars in Crimson Shallows
Gather {itemName} from Peacocks in Crimson Shallows
Gather {itemName} from Water in Ebonscale Reach
Gather {itemName} from Bushes in Crimson Shallows
Corrupted Critics
Sabotage and pillage in the Serenity Monastery for Magistrate Redridge in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"How do we stop them?"

Long ago, the Clifftop Monastery was a place where we could meditate and find solace, but these days, it rings with the din of the Corrupted.\n\nFrom up there, they spy on us and plot to sabotage our initiatives.
"We should sabotage them right back."

Ha! I love the spirit! Yes, they've been operating freely up there too long.\n\nAssault the Monastery and confiscate their plans and the implements of their surveillance. Let their activities be disrupted for a change.
Please, dearie, do make haste and visit the Clifftop Monastery.\n\nIf the Corrupted learn of our enterprise, they will try to take advantage of that.
Finally, the Corrupted are paid back for spoiling the Monastery. This intelligence will prove useful too. \n\nMost importantly, however, we can now begin our rigorous rehearsal schedule.
Sabotage the Corrupted at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect {itemName} from Corrupted
Set fire to Corrupted Scrolls
Study In Green
Collect Dryad Wood from the Ruins in Moss Mire for Artificer Long in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"Is there some way I can prove it?"

Yes, support me in my work defending the settlement. I need materials for the armaments I would forge.\n\nI have the ores, but I need wood for the hafts and stocks. The Wood of the Dryads would be most effective.
"How much do you need?"
Here, I'll write it down for youâ€¦
In her Corrupted madness, Empress Zhou believes she can build a fleet to sail back there, reclaim her throne and dominate with her Corruption across the whole world. Madness, pure madness.

Ah yes, this Dryad Wood will do nicely. The Angry Earth have a collective magic that is powerful against the Corrupted.\n\nThank you, this will help our settlement be better defended. This proves your heart is pure.
Investigate {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from Dryads
Shrine Cleansing
Cleanse the Dragon Shrine in the Dynasty Shrine for Artificer Long in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"Is there some way I can help?"

Yes. The Dragon Shrine. The Empress and I shared a love for dragons, but she twisted my work into a nexus of evil.\n\nThe Corrupted now use the shrine to conduct foul rituals and concoct dark plans. It must be cleansed.
"How do I cleanse it?"

Take this incense and burn it at the Dragon Shrine, but be prepared - the Corrupted will attempt to stop you.\n\nSearch the shrine for any information on the Empress's strategy as well. It would be useful.
The Dynasty Corrupted are a force to be reckoned with, and they are abetted by Corrupted from the Mainland.\n\nI would not be surprised if you encounter both at the Shrine.
You saw it then? The Shrine I built for her, and what she did to it... overrun with all manner of Corrupted abominations. I was ashamed.\n\nThank for making it right again.
Cleanse the {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Cleanse the Dragon Shrine
Defeat the Tiger
Collect {itemName} from chests
Tiger, Tiger
Defeat Tigers for Trophy Teeth and Defeat Makari at the Tiger Cave for Survivalist Hopkins in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"Tigers on Aeternum?"

Damn straight, the Empress brought them from the old world, but they've evolved here and become even more dangerous. We have a bounty on them.\n\nThunder Cradle's where the Tigers den. Bring me their teeth, and you'll be rewarded.
"Any tips for hunting them?"

Don't underestimate Makari and his ambush of tigers. You need to keep your mind as sharp as your blade. \n\nDon't be timid, either. These beasts can smell fear a mile away, so steady your heart before enter their lair.
The Tigers were once pets from the Empress's royal menagerie, but they've learned to be free and wild here.\n\nYou'll not a hunt a more dangerous quarry.

Looks like you really earned your stripes! In fact you could say you were absolutely purr-fect! Ha, don't give me that look, you know you love my puns.\n\nAnd here's your reward, master-hunter. You've earned it.
Hunt at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from tigers
Defeat {targetName}
Skysong's End
Kill Corrupted forces at Skysong Lagoon to interrupt the Corrupted meeting. Then report back to Artificer Long in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"We should break up this meeting."

That is a bold idea, and one which I would normally consider laughable, but you seemâ€¦ quite capable.\n\nEven you must be careful however; the meeting is set to take place in the Skysong Lagoon Temple.
"Is the Temple dangerous?"

It is the center of the Empress's power, another masterwork I now regret.\n\nIt seems this meeting includes both the Empress's agents and those of the Tempest. If you can defeat them, it would be quite a victory.
These plans suggest the construction of the Empress's fleet is actually a joint effort now with the Tempest.\n\nDisrupting this meeting at the Temple may be the most important thing we can do.

You did it, didn't you? Marched into the Temple and confronted both the Empress's and the Tempest's followers.\n\nThis is a victory that will go down in Aeternum history. I feelâ€¦ quite happy about this, as well.
Disrupt the Corrupted meeting at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Temple Troubles
Decimate the Corrupted Population of the Dynasty Mountain Temple and take out their leader XiÇŽolong. Then report back to Barkeep Bao in the Ebonscale Reach Settlement.
"What sort of task did you have in mind?"
There is a Dynasty Mountain Temple in Thunder Cradle overseen by a Corrupted warrior who goes by the name XiÇŽolong.\n\nIf you can bring down him and his Corrupted ilk it would help me greatly.
"How so?"

Well, you see, XiÇŽolong wasn't always Corrupted. He used to be a close companion of mine when we first crashed upon the shores of Aeternum.\n\nIt haunts me to know he chose serving the Empress over his own personal... connections. Taking him down would provide me with some peace of mind.
Has XiÇŽolong bested you in battle? Please do not give up. I know his skills are nothing to be scoffed at but I sense power in you, too.\n\nPlease dish out justice in a way I cannot.
So XiÇŽolong and the soldiers who followed him into Corruption are defeated. It brings me some solace in the present, but my heart will take time to mend.
Seek out Corrupted at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Justice For The Dynasty (Expedition)
Obtain Dynasty Shackles from Dynasty Shipyard Lieutenants and return them to Liberator Guo outside the Dynasty Shipyards In Ebonscale.
"Where is the injustice?"
You stand at the precipice of a critical operation for Ebonscale Reach. The people of Zhou Taiying's Dynasty have been betrayed by her turn to Corruption.
"What can I do?"
Zhou's Lieutenants in the Shipyard carry on them manacles they use to capture and contain anyone they come across. Rob them of these barbaric tools.
Taking these shackles away from the upper members of her court give adventurers and innocents a fighting chance in running from Taiying's terror.
These devices are truly the tools of an oppressor. On behalf of the people of the Dynasty, I thank you. We will melt these down and make something good of them.
Venture into the Dynasty Shipyard Expedition
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Sins of the Brothers
Take down the Pirate Lords Bartolome and Bartholomew in Thunder Harbor. Then return to Bardroy Betham.
"Is it because you named them so similarly?"
Well, yeah, that likely didn't help. \n\nBut something was always off between my two boys, even before we came to Aeternum. Once we landed on this accursed island, their relationship turned violent.
"This island can stir powerful emotions."

Aye, yes! Jealousy consumed my sons as they fought over who I favored. 

They became vicious pirates, killing each other repeatedly. They'll become Lost at this rate. 

Could you knock some sense into their addled heads?
I hope the boys are not so far gone that this lesson is in vain. \n\nSo if you find they cannot be reached and are now a menace to all, do what you must do.
They were too far gone, weren't they? It's as I feared. \n\nAt least you've brought me some measure of peace knowing my boys are completely lost. I will grieve their loss and do my best to move on.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Lucky Red
Collect a Crimson Claw from Redclaw in Euphorcea for Xiang Enlai's wedding.
"What do you need to prepare?"

My future wife and I are superstitious. We believe certain colors can bring prosperity to a marriage. \n\nRed is one such color. Presenting a red gift to her on our special day will assure marital harmony.
"What kind of red gift?"
In the ruins of Euphorcea there is an elemental bear by the name of Red Claw. \n\nObtain its crimson claw for my wedding altar and I shall reward you handsomely for it.
You will keep the details of this task between us, correct? \n\nI would prefer my bride think I hunted the beast and obtained the token myself.
What a beautiful specimen! Yes, my bride shall be most enamored with the gesture. \n\nI would offer you an invitation to the wedding, but we've already invited so manyâ€¦
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Strings of Fate
Collect Red Strings of Fate from Dynasty Corrupted at Serenity Outpost for Xiang Enlai's wedding.
"Red Strings of Fate?"

They're meant to be metaphorical, symbolizing our unbreakable connection. But I will get only the best for my darling! \n\nOr perhaps it would be better to phrase it as you will get only the best for my darling.
"So you want some red thread?"
Not just any red thread! The Dynasty Corrupted of Serenity Outpost use a brilliant red stitching in their armor. \n\nIf you could bring back several spools of it, I would be most appreciative.

Once my bride and I are husband and wife, we will be spending our honeymoon in Everfall. \n\nI heard they have a never-ending banquet there. Perhaps we could look into properties for our future family as well.
These threads are the perfect hue of red, just as my bride and I envisioned it! \n\nWith this, we shall be bound together as one. Symbolically speaking, of course.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Dynasty Corrupted for {itemName}
To Be Free
Collect four Dynasty Keys at the Skysong Shrine and use them to open four Baby Tiger Cages for Ma Xinyi.
"That sounds cruel."
Indeed! Skysong Shrine is where Corrupted acolytes twist tigers into the abominations rumored to be in the Dynasty Docks. \n\nI say we ruin their plans by setting free their charges into the wild.
"Let's do it!"

The containers around the tiger cages should contain Dynasty Keys that open the latches. Gather these and set loose those poor prisoners. \n\nAll creatures deserve to live in the dignity of their natural state.

These tigers are just the latest batch captured by the Corrupted. If only we had the power to free them allâ€¦ \n\nI hear troubling rumors of two of the babies being named for youth and gold - human vanities!
There is no more majestic sound than the roar of a tiger set free. \n\nSince the animals cannot thank you, I shall do it in their stead. Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Travel to {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from containers
Use Dynasty Keys to open Baby Tiger Cages
An Inevitability
A Wanted Posting for Ivan the Inevitable requests you defeat him on behalf of Elder Danya.
"This seems like something I can do."
WANTED: IVAN THE INEVITABLE \n\nBy order of Elder Danya of Ebonscale Reach, the graverobber-turned-lost behemoth of Ivan Monroe in the Skysong Crypt Church must be eliminated.
WANTED: IVAN THE INEVITABLE \n\nBy order of Elder Danya of Ebonscale Reach, the graverobber-turned-lost behemoth of Ivan Monroe in the Skysong Crypt Church must be eliminated.

Ah, you defeated Ivan the Inevitable? You've done us all a service. 

The villain made a habit of robbing Dynasty graves before he lost whatever was left of his soul. 

I am gladdened you took up the request. Thank you!
Defeat {targetName}
The Maddening Sound
Destroy the Corrupted Idol in the Corrupted Camp to end its pulsating influence.
"That's unfortunate."
Oh yes, especially since her heart longs for our homeland. \n\nPerhaps showing her that Corruption may be defeated would restore some hope. Then she may approve of my quest for knowledge of our past.
"How would we do that?"

There is a Corrupted Camp nearby. Malevolent idols there pulse with a maddening sound, a constant reminder of their power. \n\nCould you destroy those idols and silence the Corruption's sinister whispers?
All you need is a bow or musket to shoot down the Corrupted Idol that makes that infernal droning. Aim true, dear stranger, and my quest for knowledge may continue with renewed hope.
Ah, thank you! I know this will brighten my mother's heart. \n\nNow, to get down to the business of learning all about my beautiful homeland.
Travel to {POITags}
Destroy the Corrupted Idol
Treasured Trinkets
Collect Heirlooms at the North and South Dynasty Walls to show Yue Lai.
"I can get them for you."
That would be wonderful! \n\nI want to show my mother that even though the Storm Wall keeps us trapped on this island, we have bits of the motherland with us still.
"You do bring your homeland with you."

Yes, and studying these artifacts will bring me closer to that land. In my mind, there is no nobler cause. \n\nWill you gather these pieces of our history so I may show my mother and study them myself?
The details of these Heirlooms will teach me more about China and what the people of that land valued. \n\nThis is vital to my understanding of my true home.
Such treasure! Let's inspect these, shall we? \n\nOh, these designs are exquisite, like nothing I have seen beforeâ€¦
Travel to {POITags}
Collect Heirlooms
Travel to {POITags}
Collect Heirlooms
Legacy Reclaimed
Collect Scrolls of Lineage from Corrupted at Dynasty Shipwreck for Yue Lai to study.
"I'm sure she had a good reason."

Yes, you're likely correct. I must proceed carefully. This warrants further investigation. \n\nThe shipwreck of the boat that carried us is rumored to have lists of the passengers. Are you up for one more task?
"I suppose I could do one more."

Oh, excellent! 

Find the Scrolls of Lineage at the Dynasty Shipwreck. The Corrupted likely gathered all documents for the Empress, so be prepared to wrest them from their hands. 

I must discover the identity of this other Lai.
Could it be that I have a long-lost relative? Did that relative make it to Aeternum? \n\nSo many questions buzz in my head like curious honeybeesâ€¦

You have the scrolls! 

Oh, oh my... The other Lai was... my father?! 

This is why my mother never spoke of it. He died weeks after I was born in Shang Wu's uprising. 

Thank you. Perhaps now I can begin to mend my mother's broken heart.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Corrupted for {itemName}
The Last Argument
Help Wang Tangzhi and Alvaro de Villanueva construct their masterpiece Blunderbuss.
"You have my full attention."

Excellent! This will require materials of the highest quality. But you donâ€™t strike me as someone whoâ€™d shy away from a bit of danger to acquire them. \nAh, such a weapon weâ€™ll craft for you. It will be the pinnacle of our work!
"Who is we?"

Me and my partner, Alvaro de Villanueva. These first components are for him, for an exquisite stock. \n\nWith the preparations Iâ€™ve given you, he should have no problem with this piece... regardless of what he might say.
Complete: "A Stock of Ironwood"
Complete: "Polished to a Shine"
Complete: "A Precision Lock"
Complete: "Handcrafted to Perfection"
Complete: "A Receiver Most Elegant"
Complete: "Quenched in Darkness"
Complete: "Barrels of Unerring Accuracy"
Complete: "Ignition of Sublime Flame"
A Stock of Ironwood
Travel to Edengrove and acquire the ingredients needed to prepare a stock for the Blunderbuss.
... and a bit of gold inlay here, and then... \n\nHm? Have I forgotten something? You have the list of items for Alvaro, yes? I am eager to see the finished product.

So, Tangzhi has you collecting what's needed for this weapon, eh? \n\nI wonder what he's asked you to find. Probably something absurd, like a single feather from a remote mountaintop, used to apply a speck of gold as an accent.
In Edengrove:
Seek a needed ingredient in the area of {POITags}
Obtain {itemName} from Dryad Elementalists in the nearby caves
Gather {itemName} from plants around the central crater lake
Polished to a Shine
Prepare and craft the Hardened Ironwood Planks for Alvaro to craft the stock.

And so it begins. I requested regular Ironwood, not treated with whatever this is. I'll need to revise the measurements, conduct pressure and stress testing... \n\nI just hope that it hasn't changed the structure too terribly.
"I collected everything on the list."

Yes, you did. If only Tangzhi treated this as a weapon rather than some fashion accessory, weâ€™d be fine! \n\nMust everything be gilded or filigreed or have the right 'feel'? A good weapon must be functional, first and foremost.
Acquire all needed ingredients:
{ItemName}
Find, craft, or purchase {itemName}
Craft the needed Hardened Ironwood Planks at a Woodworking Workbench
A Precision Lock
Travel to Reekwater and seek out the components needed to complete the lock of the Blunderbuss.
"What do you need from me?"

What we need will be dangerous to acquire. The pirates in Reekwater have flintlock pistols of unique make. Thatâ€™s what we need. Get some of those weapons if you can. We'll also need slivers of platinum, freshly mined.
"Anything else?"

There is also a cannon their hulking beasts use, resembles our blunderbuss. Find designs for that and it may solve another problem. \n\nWith all of that, and the original design, you should be able to put the pieces together.

Alvaro has you finding designs for the lock? Ai ya, he relies too much on numbers and measurements! \n\nHe has no feel for the artistry! No passion! If it were up to him, every design would be hard edges and bare wood! No life!
I've given you everything you need, and pointed you in the right direction. I have plenty to do already. \n\nI can't be out marching through swamps and piecing this together on my own, now can I?
Travel to {POITags} in Reekwater for a needed ingredient
Collect {itemName} from Pistol-wielding Pirates
Locate the {itemName}
Gather {itemName} from Platinum veins throughout Aeternum
Handcrafted to Perfection
Craft the final pieces of the Blunderbuss lock using the recovered components.

I knew this would happen! No critique of your abilities, just on the changes he's made to the design itself. \n\nThese hard lines, a complete lack of style. This doesnâ€™t stand out! A wielder would take no pride in showing this off!
"Will there be a problem?"
No, no problem. I'm certain the lock will perform admirably. \n\nIt will take some effort to elevate this weapon to a work of beauty without disrupting the function, but I'm up to the task.
Acquire all needed ingredients:
{ItemName}
Find, craft, or purchase {itemName}
Craft the Custom Blunderbuss Lock at an Engineering Workbench
A Receiver Most Elegant
Fill the receiver with azoth powder and gold, found throughout Aeternum.
"And these items are rare?"

The azoth, yes. The catalyst? Flakes of pure gold will be just fine, actually, and straight from a fresh vein. \n\nOnce you have the azoth and gold sealed within the receiver, it will require a... field test.
"Not sure I like the way you said that."

Alas, azoth can be reactive in the presence of Corruption. The seals must hold up under the stress of battle. Youâ€™ll need to carry it to where Corruption is the strongest, such as the breaches that appear across the island.

Crushed rubies in the resin should bring out the color nicely! Now, what can I-- \n\nAh, you are back! Have you filled the receiver and brought it for Alvaro? If not, I suggest you hurry. He isâ€¦ difficult when made to wait.
Is that Tangzhi's receiver? Hmm, azoth mix with a catalyst... interesting design. Risky. Surprised he thought about field testing it.
Gather {itemName} from Azoth Springs throughout Aeternum
Gather {itemName} from Gold Veins throughout Aeternum
Quenched in Darkness
Test the receiver's durability by assaulting Corruption Breaches throughout Aeternum.

Finished with the receiver, have you? 

Hrm... internals are a bit overdesigned. Could've used a different metal for the frame. Seals could be a bit thicker, too... 

Well, I suppose it'll have to do.
"Come on! Even I know this is good work."

Fine! The work is good, excellent even! Nice and sturdy construction, properly reinforced, nowhere near as gaudy as his other work. Even the decorations here serve a purpose! \n\nHappy now? Just don't tell Tangzhi I said soâ€¦
Defeat Corrupted near Corruption Breaches to test the receiver's durability
Barrels of Unerring Accuracy
Collect the components needed to reforce the barrels of the Blunderbuss.
"You're sounding more like Tangzhi."

Hold on now! You won't catch me carving fire-breathing dragons on my barrels! Or adding gilded inlay to my stocks! 

But perhaps some of my designs could be improved upon, be a bit less severe. 

And speaking of barrelsâ€¦
"I need to get the materials for those?"

For the barrelsâ€™ reinforcement, yes. I'll need muskets used in the Imperial Palace. And that strong armor their warriors wear. \n\nAlso some good rivets to bind everything. The pirates near there might have some you can acquire.

He liked it? Really! We are speaking of the same Alvaro and not another that you met in your travels? \n\nThat is surprising. I've gotten used to his complaints about my work, but a compliment? Hmmâ€¦
I've got a bit more calibrating to do on these barrels. I have some thinking to do. We can talk more when you have those pieces for me.

Good, good! Yes, let me see the... hmmâ€¦ \n\nYou know, seeing these pieces together, there is something poetic about it all: the raw austerity of his designs, paired with my artistry... quite a pleasant duality to the work.
"He took your suggestions to heart."

Apparently. I can tell itâ€™s his handiwork, but there is more grace than usual in the form, even in the starkness of the presentation. Only minor changes from my request, as well... \n\nThis endeavor might succeed after all.
Travel to the {POITags} to collect ingredients from the Imperial Guards
Search {POITags} for the needed rivets
In the Imperial Palace:
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
In Stormcourt Shipment:
Gather {itemName} from Armor Piles
Ignition of Sublime Flame
Obtain the ingredients needed for the Gunpowder Additive, then craft it and deliver it to Alvaro.
"What is the additive?"

The Corrupted gunners at the base of Shattered Mountain use a strange form of charcoal for their gunpowder. \n\nAlvaro discovered that mixing this strange charcoal with regular gunpowder would produce an even stronger force!
"Any changes to this recipe, then?"

Alvaro and I have our differences, but I've always trusted his work. Perhaps I need to make that clearer to himâ€¦ \n\nWhere measurements and precision are concerned, heâ€™s unequaled. So exactly as his recipe states â€“ no changes.

Are the gemstones too much? Do they add anything? Should I simplify? \n\nSorry, just reviewing some other designs. Was there something else you needed? We should be finished assembling the weapon by the time you return.

We just need that additive to tie it all together. Don't tinker with the recipe! Getting the mixture wrong could have deadly consequences. \n\nSuppose that's less of a problem on this island, but you might damage the weapon!
Travel to {POITags} in Shattered Mountain to find the rare ingredient
Collect {itemName} from defeated {targetName}
Gather or purchase {itemName}
Craft the Gunpowder Additive at an Engineering Workbench

You have the mixture! Let me give it a taste... Tastes as foul as I remember, but in the right proportions! \n\nTangzhi and I have assembled everything. I just need to get this seated in the receiver, and we should be set.
"Tangzhi made certain I followed the recipe."

Good! It would've blown up in your face, otherwise! \n\nGiven what you've done for the gun, and for Tangzhi and I, we think 'Last Argument' is a proper name for this piece. Certainly for whoever you happen to point it at!
Even timid animals are at risk of being turned into Corrupted weapons. But tigers... tigers are another matter entirely.
To Be Free
Free the baby tigers for Ma Xinyi.
The darling cubs who used to roam my area have disappeared. What if... they're being turned to Corruption as we speak?
"Fate can be cruel."
Even if the babies make it out alive, I doubt their minds will be intact. The innocent animals. We must help them!
Those predators! These cubs are only their most recent victims. But imagine if we could free them allâ€¦
Free baby tigers in {POITags}
Gather {itemName} to unlock tiger cages
Open Baby Tiger cages
The little ones roar their thanks. You have my gratitude, along with this humble reward.
It warms my heart to see the precious creatures roaming freely again. You did a noble thing, adventurer.
Life went by so quickly when I had adventure in me. Now, all I can do is watch the leaves fall from the Ironwoods.
Scourging The Scourge
Defeat Ivan The Scourge for Elder Danya.
WANTED by Order of Elder Danya: IVAN THE SCOURGE, Grave-Robber, now Lost Behemoth and Utter Nuisance, must be eliminated.
"Utter Nuisance, hmm..."
WANTED by Order of Elder Danya: IVAN THE SCOURGE, Grave-Robber, now Lost Behemoth and Utter Nuisance, must be eliminated.
WANTED by Order of Elder Danya: IVAN THE SCOURGE, Grave-Robber, now Lost Behemoth and Utter Nuisance, must be eliminated.
Defeat {targetName}
Ah! You've done us all a service. The reprobate made a habit of robbing graves before he lost his soul.
Flowers for the Departed
Place the flowers at Skysong Crypt to check if Elder Danya's comrades have found peace.
Would you place these flowers at the altar and hear if they tell of my comrades' salvation?
"The flowers will speak?"
It's an ancient rite. Put a flower on a gravestone and if it blossoms there, the soul underneath lies peacefully.
Have you placed the flowers at the crypt?
Take the flowers to {POITags}
Place the flowers at the altar
Defeat Elder Danya's Friends
You're back at last! Did you place the flowers safely? Did they bloom? How are my friends? Tell me everything!
"Your friends attacked me."
That is sad news. They were good peopleâ€¦ Perhaps one day they'll have the quiet slumber they deserve.
I still think about my friends often. The best I can do for them is remember them fondly.
Retriving What Was Stolen (ALT)
Search the chests at Skysong Crypt for items stolen from graves.
What are youths coming to? Robbing the departed, desecrating the graves of my friends... These tombs are made to remember those who have been lost, how can you steal from them like that?
"Let's retrieve what was stolen."
Oh, would you? My friends' possessions hold fond memories for me. I wouldn't want them rotting in a box or sold as common trinkets!
Were you able to recover my friends' effects?
Search the chests at Skysong Crypt for items stolen from graves.
Lilian's Lucky Compass. She was always saying she'd leave this island before me. I guess she didâ€¦
The Corrupted Streak
Defeat the group of Corrupted tigers for Ma Xinyi and end the cycle.
A Corrupted tiger returned to the area yesterday. I was happy, at first, because I thought she'd regained her senses.
"Did she come back for her cubs?"
Wishful thinking! The Corrupted forced her here to lure the cubs back to them. How do we break this cycle?
"By removing the tigers."

string.comment: First part of the current VO works as is. Please trim out anything that comes after so it matches the text here.
string.speaker: Ma Weizhe
string.name: MaWeizhe

resources.string: That is true, but I will miss seeing them near hereâ€¦
Did you put the darlings to rest?
Drive off Corrupted Tigers at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from tigers
Defeat {targetName}

string.comment: First part of the current VO works as is. Please trim out anything that comes after so it matches the text here.
string.speaker: Ma Weizhe
string.name: MaWeizhe

resources.string: Tigers will always have a special place with meâ€¦
Sometimes doing the right thing hurts. I'll miss the tigers. What a shame this had to happenâ€¦
Do you think the Corrupted have their own culture or are they too barbaric?
The Mystery Within
Help Yue study the Corrupted nodule at Imperial Army Campsite.
Can you see that pustulous ball? The Corrupted have been guarding it watchfully for some time now. I wonder whyâ€¦
"Why don't you take a closer look?"
I have no desire to get closer to Corrupted slime. But perhaps you could examine it? I have a few coins that I can offer.
So, what do the Corrupted see in that that nodule?
Examine the Corruted nodule at {POITags}
Destroy the nodule
Ah, wonderful! Time to study this stone and understand how the Corrupted thinkâ€¦
Treasured Trinkets
Recover Chinese heirlooms from the Corrupted and give them to Yue so she can discover more about her past.
You know what infuriates me about the Corrupted? They raid and take whatever they want.
"Didn't we do just that?"
Not even close. The Corrupted take over our land, our people and now our memories. Why'd they need those artifacts, anyway?
"So it isn't their creation?"
The Empress brought that, and other artifacts, from the mainland. MY land! We really need to recover them. It's OUR history.
Any luck with the artifacts? Or are the Corrupted impossible to overcome?
Go to {POITags}
Collect Heirlooms for Yue
Go to {POITags}
Collect Heirlooms for Yue
I was an infant when I got here, and I know nothing of my old home â€” except from stories. This will help me learn of it!
These clay relics show the value my ancestors placed on beauty and simplicity. I'll do my best to perserve their feelings!
It's a blessing we can't get more wee ones on this island. I have two. Two barrels of misfortune I wouldn't wish on any sod.
Sins of the Brothers
Help Bardroy's sons, Bartolome and Bartholomew see sense and stop fighting each other.
The name's Bardroy Byrne. I'd introduce you to my sons, Bartolome and Bartholomew, but they are driving me mad.
"Families stir powerful emotions."
I don't even remember what they're fighting over, and I doubt they do either. Killed each other repeatedly! I've had it. Go knock sense into 'em.
I pray my boys are not too far gone. They may be addlepated idiots, but... they are mine.
Meet Bardroy's sons in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Those reckless loons. My plan didn't work! They're still at each other's throats. But I'll find a way to make them see reasonâ€¦ despite this being Lost business.
I do treasure my boys, even if they've forgotten that they're family. I'll figure this out, you'll see.
Small cheer and great welcome makes a merry feast. And you've come to a bounteous meal indeed!
The Show Must Go On
Get black ink from Void Pitchers so Magistrate Redridge may complete her play about the Empress.
What a craven lot the Corrupted are, exploiting the weak to increase their numbers. We must arm the innocent against them!
"Is anyone without weapons today?"
No, no, no, that's not the answer. We give the wide-eyed masses an idea. A belief. We are more than a community. We are a symbol against darkness!
"How can we show this to everyone?"
Theatre educates! Imagine: the Life of Our Empress. A force in China and our guardian on Aeternum. If only I had the inkâ€¦
"What sort of ink do you need?"
The black dye from the eponymous fungus that gives Ebonscale Reach its name. Nothing else will do for our Empress!
Pray tell, did you get that fungus yet? The theatre eagerly awaits your contribution!
Collect {itemName} from Void Pitchers around Ebonscale Reach
Splendid! With this, I can complete 'The Empress's Journey' â€” my script! For the Empress. And her people!
Keep fighting the good fight, dear patron of the arts. And, please, spread word of my magnificent production!
I designed our shrines by pushing the paradigm. You will notice each one makes you feel different based on its element.
Study In Green
Acquire Dryad Wood for Artificer Long to craft robust armor against the Corrupted.
Ah, you've met the Empress. Sufficiently impressed by her achievements, I'd assume.
"She does exhude confidence."
Everyone says the same. Yet where would she be without the throne she sits on, the shrines she commands? I built them all.
"She'd respond as needed, right?"
Why do I expect an amateur to see my genius? No matter. You seem capable, perhaps you can do the Empress a favor. I need Dryad Wood to craft her people armor.
Well? Don't you have the Dryad Wood yet? I am waiting.
Get Dryad Wood from {POITags}
Defeat Dryads to collect {itemName}
Oh, I was right about you! Capable indeed - not many make it back alive. This wood will do nicely... The Empress thanks you!
Ebonscale Reach needs everyone to play their part in the war against the Corrupted. I will craft. What will you do?
Family Puzzles
Return the puzzle box to Bardroy and discover the prize his sons were fighting to own.
I miss my oafsâ€¦ I discovered what they were fighting for before. Trying to inherit my puzzle box. And now that theyâ€™re Lostâ€¦ itâ€™s the last connection we share.
"What's in the box?"
You helped me previously. I don't mind sharing whatâ€™s insideâ€¦ if you retrieve it. Deal? Still in some cargo the pirates filched from me long time back.
Did you find my puzzle box yet? You wouldn't be able to open it without me, mind. In case the greed got you tooâ€¦
Retrieve the puzzle box from {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
Defeat {targetName} to Collect {itemName}
So, the contents of this box? Rum aged one-hundred years. A legend of the seas! Caramel. Smoky. As smooth as a lady's glove.
There are three worthy things in this life - guts, glory and rum. And the third is the sweetest.
Shrine Cleansing
Cleanse Skysong Shrine for Artificer Long.
My sources told me you burnt an incense for the Prince?
"No child should live like that."
Cure the abominable royal child while Corruption infects the land. My shrine needs cleansing and nobody offers to help!
"I will. How would I cleanse it?"
Burn this incense in the sanctum. My incense should drive away the evil spirits, including the Corrupted.
Sigh. I knew it. You really didn't intend to help me either, did you? My poor shrine wilts! From the inside out!
Talk to Yue
Is everything alright? I saw you talking to Artificer Longâ€¦ who is very animated today.
"She asked me for help."
Ha. She lost the few friends she had by spouting nonsense against the Empress. I'd be wary of her if I were you.
"But she's making armor for all."
What deeds? If you saw the armory, the citizens, you'd see how little she's actually crafted since the shrines fell.
Defeat {targetName}
Cleanse the Dragon Shrine
Collect {itemName} from chests
You saw the shrine overrun with all manner of Corrupted horrors? I was afraid of that. Without cleansing, the Corrupted must have taken it over.
The Corrupted tide will wash over Aeternum if we donâ€™t stop them.
Legacy Reclaimed
Collect Passenger Scrolls from the Corrupted for Yue to study.
After digging through a Corrupted campsite, I discovered there may still be artifacts on the ship that brought me here!
"You could learn about yourself."
Exactly! Apparently, the cabin would have had a list of passengers. I may find other people who traveled with me!
"I can find that list."
You are very kind! The shipwreck is crawling with the Corrupted. Return safely. I'm starting to like you.
Could the other passengers tell me about my life in China? Oh! Don't let them be Corrupted or Lost!
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Corrupted to Collect {itemName}
You did it! Please, let me see. Hmâ€¦ According to this, a perfumer called Muthalaly was on the same journey.
You are a good friend. Let's trounce these Corrupted together. And let me know if you see a Muthalaly?
My sweetheart is so beautiful, the moon and flowers feel embarrassed when compared to her.
The Red Claw
Collect a Crimson Paw from Redclaw for a red dye for Xiang Enlai.
I will spend the rest of my life with Yue. But first, I need to find the perfect red strings for her.
"Why does she want red strings?"
They're used in the Hair Combing ceremony. And that will protect us as a coupleâ€¦ if she'll have me.
"Isnâ€™t dying a string easier?"
Yue is a romantic. She loves the idea of me fighting a Red Claw for the red stringâ€¦ but I can't do that alone.
You will keep the details of this task between us, correct? I want Yue to think I fought the Red Claw myself.
Seek the Redclaw at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
The Red Claw! Defeated? You're brave, like Yue. I hope she likes the red string and says 'yes'. Then we'll be married!
Ah, the things we do for love. I've known Yue since we were children. She's always wanted what she's wanted.
Serenity In Chaos
Destroy Corrupted forces at Serenity Monastery. Then report back to Artificer Long.
The Empress was more mother than ruler. The Corrupted multiplied with no one to rein them in. Thus we're here, in this mess.
"What have you been doing?"
Gathering intelligence for when the time is right to use it.
I hear there's going to be an important Corrupted meeting at a monastery, if youâ€™d care to disrupt it.
Did you disrupt the meeting, or were you too busy thinking about what I should and shouldn't have done?
Disrupt the Corrupted meeting at {POITags}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
The Empress's mind was clouded. I can see that yours is much clearer. I do value everything you've done for me.
I trust Liang won't repeat the mistakes of his mother. Only time will tell if he deserves my support.
Strings of Fate
Retrieve red strings from Dynasty Corrupted for Xiang Enlai and Yue.
I'm sorry to disturb you, but our plan didn't work. A Red Paw doesn't make a red dye. Yue wants different red strings now.
"Veins from a Corruption Swarmer?"
Not quite. Yue wants the red strings the Imperial Guards use for their armor. It is tangible fabric. Could you help me once again?
Once Yue and I are married, we'll spend our honeymoon in Everfall. I hear they have a never-ending banquet there.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Dynasty Corrupted for {itemName}
These are the perfect strings. I can't wait to show them to Yue. She'll say 'yes' to me now!
When Yue accepts, I'll be a very happy man. And when we get married, you'll be our guest of honor!
Revenge of a Playwright
Sabotage the Corrupted operations as payback for spoiling Redridge's play.
The Corrupted have dealt us a mighty blow by taking Empress Zhou Taiying. They've sabotaged my play and all it stood for!
"We should sabotage them in turn."
Yesâ€¦ Yes! We've been gentle with the Corrupted for too long. Think therefore on revenge and cease to weep!
Let's teach the Corrupted it's NEVER a good idea to mess with the arts!
Sabotage the Corrupted at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from chests
Collect {itemName} from Corrupted
Destroy Corrupted Scrolls
The Corrupted deserved everything you gave them and more. They will rue the day they hurt our Empress and my play!
Rehearsals of my new work 'Furious Fist' have begun. It's loosely based on what you've accomplished here in Ebonscale Reach.
The Empress needs all the allies she can get in these trying times.
Statuette Stash
Collect four Statuettes as told by handmaiden Zeng, to disrupt the Corrupted ritual.
I recovered a Corrupted dragon statue from the Wood Shrineâ€¦ and I fear this dark power within could be used to siphon souls.
"Siphoning souls! But from where?"
Master Qi has said every soul that enters a temple leaves an imprint upon the place.
A temple is not only of stone, or wood, or other materials. The larger part is an unseen energy imbued by our souls.
"That energy shouldnâ€™t be misused."
There is no precedent for interfering with such power, but the consequences of our inaction may be far worse.
Hurry and gather the other statues before it is too late. We can't let the Corrupted get a hold of such power!
Collect the {itemName} from the Air Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Water Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Earth Shrine
Collect the {itemName} from the Fire Shrine
I'll store these statues carefully. We don't want them to break and unleash... whatever Corruption lies within.
Despite the dangers, I hope you can find some measure of peace and comfort in those shrines. They are beautiful.
End of Her Reign (Expedition)
Defeat Empress Zhou Taiying and her Captains. Then report back to Zeng Lingyun in the Ebonscale Settlement.
Poor Liang! To lose a mother and assume the Dragon Throne at the same time. All while our people suffer still...
"The Empress was loved."
I'd ask Liang for help, but his wounds are too fresh. Corrupted Empress Zhou besieges the docks with her 'loyal' handmaidens.
"Another mindless minion..."
I beseech you to stop her. You'll need these statues to guide you; they now have a strange power over the Corrupted.
"The statues from the shrines!"
They will lure out powerful Corrupted, like our Empress. I served her for so many years. And now I... ask you to defeat her.
I will wish you good fortune. Empress Zhou Taiying was always formidable. Perhaps even more so now in her Corruptionâ€¦
Venture into the {POITags}
Defeat Empress Zhou
News of your valor has reached us! It was a sad thing to ask of youâ€¦ but I am grateful. The shipyards are safe. For nowâ€¦
Every day I teach Liang more about statecraft. But alas! Nothing can fill the void left by a mother.
Craving silk like the Empress wears? The royal silk is reserved for her, but I know how to get one just like it.
Magistrate Redridge needs to write a new play? I can share stories of my life with her... for a price.
The trick of the market is you need to buy low and sell high. There are gullible fools at both ends.
Admiring the tiles? Do you know each one is shaped on a wooden mold?
Long called them HER shrines? Ask her who created the tiles. Sure, she designed them but a team of us built them TOGETHER.
Yongtai will say she has 'silks as rich as those of the Empress' and then peddle her lower weaves to you. Don't be fooled.
You've got battle scars. You know the joy of pain! Give acupuncture a go. It opens up the muscles, makes you feel aliveâ€¦
Heard you helped Enlai get his red string. If you find an acupuncturist, the needles are on me!
One must not only look beautiful, one must smell beautiful. Appeal to all the senses of the observer. Like our Empress does.
You saw the ship? It brought me here with the Empress. I was selling perfumes in China, when she made me part of her retinue.
A few peasants sent their children with us. They hoped for better lives with the Empress, than at home. Could Yue be one?
Does Prince Liang really look like... a monster? I guess no one can have it all.
On the positive side, Prince Liang looks prettier. On the negative side, I'll have even less luck with the girls.
No Corrupted going in. No Corrupted going out. Ebonscale Reach is safe.
Guanyu is a turkey with his head in the dirt. The Corrupted have overrun the shrines, the roads, any camp they could find!
You know even if I die, I'll be reborn. So will you. I don't know what I'm guarding. The royal order? An accepted story?
We're honored to host you at the Three Perfections inn. There are many sights and many meals to enjoy here in Ebonscale!
The fishing here is good, eh? I used to fish with comorants in China. Here, I rely on a good fishing line and bait.
Looks like you've been fishing for a while. I'm an expert on the fish here, if you'd ever like to discuss it over a meal.
One day, I'd like to start up a fishing tournament in remembrance of Tu Benjun. Wouldn't that be splendid?
Hello there! Are you new to Ebonscale Reach? Yes, I think so!
If you're the hunting type, you'll find Ebonscale has a variety of wildlife unlike anywhere else on Aeternum.
